doc.after: Lions spend much of their time resting and are inactive for about 20Â hours per day.[61] Although lions can be active at any time, their activity generally peaks after dusk with a period of socializing, grooming, and defecating. Intermittent bursts of activity follow through the night hours until dawn, when hunting most often takes place. They spend an average of two hours a day walking and 50Â minutes eating.[62]
